article.headline: Robert Morris tops St. Francis (Pa.) 73-68
article.story: MOON TOWNSHIP, Pa. -- Karvel Anderson scored 24 points as Robert Morris came back from a late 11-point deficit to beat St. Francis (Pa.) 73-68 on Thursday night. Robert Morris (8-10, 3-0 Northeast Conference) trailed 65-54 with less than 4 1/2 minutes to play but ended on a 19-3 run to win the game. The Colonials' late run came right after St. Francis had scored 15 straight points to erase a 54-49 deficit of its own. Robert Morris hit 8 of 17 from beyond the arc, including 5 of 10 from Anderson, who was coming off back-to-back 30-point performances. The Colonials also shot well from the free throw line, where they hit 19 of 22. Lucky Jones and Jeremiah Worthem each added 12 points apiece for Robert Morris. St. Francis (3-13, 1-2) shot 58.5 percent from the field and was 11 of 23 on 3-pointers. Malik Harmon led the Red Flash with 21 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
